attributes.comment:
As an adoptive parent it is troubling to see that there is a proposal to increase
filing fees by an average of 66% over current fees. I can understand that costs do
increase over time, to be able to maintain a level of service. However this increase
is quite considerable.

The financial burden on adoptive parents has already been acknowledged by the
adoption tax credit. It seems illogical to help families be able to afford the
incredible expense of building a family and then punish them in another area by
drastically raising fees. Adoption is the only choice for many families who want to
have children.

The fact is, there is a financial burden when a family adopts. Help
our family, and so many others like us, by truly examining this proposal and
making an effort to keep the filing fees affordable. If there needs to be an increase
in fees to cover the costs let it be a reasonable amount. Does 66% sounds
reasonable?

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Karla Stirling
